newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Reef Casino says bankers serve notice.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Reef Casino says bankers serve notice.

text.p: Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd told Reef Casino Trust on Thursday it will issue a formal notice asking the Trust to rectify breaches of financing convenants within 14 days of the notice, Reef said.
The ANZ, as agent for the Trust's financing syndicate, told the trust manager and trustee of its intention at a meeting on Thursday, Reef told the Australian Stock Exchange.

The meeting followed a decision by the financiers at end-December to withdraw an external working capital facility used to fund high-rolling gambler visits to the Reef Casino at Cairns in north Queensland.

The operator of the loss-making casino, Casinos Austria International Ltd (CAI), said on Wednesday that junket and premium player gaming at the Reef Casino would not be available until further notice as a result.
"The ANZ Bank further advised that it reserved its rights in the event that there is a failure to rectify these breaches," Reef Casino Trust said on Thursday.
"A meeting of the directors of the Trust Manager has been called for Monday 13 January 1997 to consider the proposed action by the financiers," the Trust added.
"As previously advised, Grant Samuel & Associates has been appointed to advise the Trust on its refinancing and restructuring options," it said.
A report from Grant Samuel will be provided to the board meeting on Monday.
Reef hired Grant Samuel in October after the trust reported a A$5.9 million loss for the quarter ended September 30.
